recipes.title: Gnocchi with creamy tomato & spinach sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Gnocchi on the menu? Try pairing with Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. The Selvapiana Chianti Rufina with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Selvapiana Chianti Rufina
productMatches.description: This is a big and juicy Chianti Rufina, offering delicious strawberry and cherry aromas followed by subtle notes of spice box, leather, earth and mushrooms. Dense, smooth and medium-bodied, with great concentration and fine tannins.Easy-going and supple, this is great food wine: ideal for rich pastas, creamy soups, barbecued meats and cheeses.

recipes.instructions: Heat the olive oil in a frying pan. Fry thegarlic until golden, then add the tomatoes.Season, then simmer for 10 mins. Stir inmascarpone, then cook for 2 mins more.Meanwhile, boil the gnocchi accordingto pack instructions. Add the spinach forthe final min of cooking. Drain well, pourback into the pan, then stir the saucethrough. Mix well and serve immediatelywith basil leaves and Parmesan shavingsscattered over, if you like.

steps.step: Heat the olive oil in a frying pan. Fry thegarlic until golden, then add the tomatoes.Season, then simmer for 10 mins. Stir inmascarpone, then cook for 2 mins more.Meanwhile, boil the gnocchi accordingto pack instructions.
Add the spinach forthe final min of cooking.
Drain well, pourback into the pan, then stir the saucethrough.
Mix well and serve immediatelywith basil leaves and Parmesan shavingsscattered over, if you like.
